newsitem.title: USA: Harmon wins $2.3 mln Brazilian contract.
newsitem.headline: Harmon wins $2.3 mln Brazilian contract.

text.p: Harmon Industries Inc said Tuesday it has been awarded a $2.3 million contract with Cia Vale Do Rio Doce (CVRD) of Sao Luis, Brazil.
Harmon supplies signal and control equipment for railroads in North America and in international markets.

CVRD will upgrade its existing train control system to Harmon's on-board cab signaling system, Ultra-Cab II. The Harmon Ultra-Cab system will detect coded cab signals from the rails and support both automatic train stop and automatic train control functions, such as speed and braking control of the trains.
This work follows a previous contract, for which Harmon released and shipped wayside, train control and track circuit equipment to the CVRD during the second quarter of 1997.

CVRD provides rail service for transportation of iron ore from the Carajas mines to the shipping port of Sao Luis in northern Brazil. CVRD also provides limited passenger service over the 588-mile railway.
